availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick H. Bierbower (Maysville, Kentucky, attorney. Capt & major 40th KY Inf USA, Col over Camp Nelson)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Pennsylvania native. Son of Johnathan A. Bierbower and Lucetta Bierbower. Student in Maysville in 1850. Attorney in Maysville in 1860. Mayor of Maysville in 1862. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain and major from September 1, 1863, to December 30, 1864. Commandant of Camp Nelson from July 18, 1865, to August 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 115B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 329.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 2, p. 413.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 431.
"Frederick Huber Bierbower (1833-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #156273789,
accessed December 17, 2018, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/156273789.
Richard D. Sears, Camp Nelson, Kentucky: A Civil War History, (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2002), 230, 244.
KYR-0001-020-1800.
